Key Match Events: South Africa pulled off a seven-run win over defending champion England in the Super Eight playoffs
Quinton de Kock finished with 65 as he smacked the tournament's joint-fastest half-century off 22 balls

Harry Brook, who made 53, and Liam Livingstone, with 33 off 17 balls, had the chase in control for England with 25 needed off 18 balls until fast bowlers Kagiso Rabada and Anrich Nortje dismissed them in the last three overs
Post-Match Reflections: Aiden Markram said, "Getting to those last three overs, the odds looked heavily against you, but the bowlers came back, it shows a lot of skill and shows the fight inside"
Miscellaneous Highlights: The West Indies fans partied under the Friday night lights as new team addition Shai Hope launched a spectacular display of power-hitting
Roston Chase took a career-best 3-19 and Andre Russell 3-31 as the West Indies limited the United States to 128 in 19.5 overs
Others: The United States began well and despite the loss of Steven Taylor in the second over, reached a healthy 48-1 after the six-over power play
After a loss to England in their first Super Eight match, the West Indies had to win to stay in semifinal contention
